intro: Lepidium ruderale var. microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited peppergrass, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruits are tiny, spherical pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
